channel.title: RSS Aggregator Feed
channel.description: An aggregated feed of Technology-related news

item.title: Here's the Company That Sold DHS ICE's Notorious Face Recognition App
item.description: Immigration agents have used Mobile Fortify to scan the faces of countless people in the US—including many citizens.

item.title: Netflix Might Be Back on the ‘Gundam’ Movie, Again
item.description: After its own plans for a live-action take on the iconic mecha anime fell apart, the streamer could be back on board to distribute Legendary's reworked plans for 'Gundam.'

item.title: The Doomsday Clock Is Now 85 Seconds to Midnight. Here’s What That Means
item.description: Catastrophic risks are increasing, cooperation is declining, and swift action is needed from global leaders to correct course.

item.title: SpaceX Won’t Go Public Until the Planets Literally Align, Sources Say
item.description: Elon Musk’s aerospace company is reportedly targeting a mid-June IPO because there will be a spectacular planetary alignment that month. Yes, really.

item.title: I used Claude to vibe-code my wildly overcomplicated smart home
item.description: I am not, by any definition, a coder, but when I started seeing people's vibe-coded smart home projects all over my social feeds this month, I was intrigued. From a "master command center" built on a Lutron system to AI controlling a smart oven, people were unleashing AI in their smart homes, using Claude Code […]

item.title: What is the release date for Spartacus: House of Ashur episode 9 on Starz?
item.description: After last week's shock death, Spartacus: House of Ashur episode 9 could be the calm before the finale storm. But when does it air on Starz?

item.title: Interview : ce que la mission de Sophie Adenot va changer pour la recherche… et pour nous
item.description: Dans quelques jours ou semaines, Sophie Adenot partira dans la Station spatiale internationale (ISS). Lors de son séjour, elle aura de nombreuses expériences à mener dans le cadre de sa mission Epsilon, dont des expériences françaises conçues depuis le Cnes, à Toulouse.

item.title: The entry-level Samsung Galaxy Buds FE are on sale for $30 off
item.description: If past timing is any indication, Samsung is likely to hold its next Unpacked event in late February. However, we’re not expecting the company to shake up its earbuds lineup until the summer — the winter keynote is typically reserved for smartphone announcements — which makes today’s discount on the Galaxy Buds FE far more […]

item.title: How Winter Storm Fern Slowed Down the Bitcoin Network
item.description: When an immutable blockchain meets unstoppable force of nature.

item.title: Samsung Galaxy S26 will have ‘pixel level’ privacy feature, Samsung confirms
item.description: Samsung is being vague for now, but expect better privacy features on the next Galaxy phones.

item.title: WhatsApp will now charge AI chatbots to operate in Italy
item.description: WhatsApp plans to charge developers of AI chatbots per message.

item.title: The Post-Apocalyptic Intrigue Gets Even Wilder in ‘Paradise’ Season 2
item.description: Hulu's hit mystery returns to find Sterling K. Brown's character exploring a deeply damaged planet—while the bunker-dwellers back home deal with a new crisis.

item.title: Movies Theaters Will Sell a Melania Trump Popcorn Bucket This Weekend
item.description: What a world.

item.title: Tim Cook calls for deescalation but avoids criticizing Trump after Minneapolis death
item.description: Apple’s internal letter called for “deescalation,” but avoided criticizing the president, sparking anger among employees in the wake of the Minneapolis shooting. Trump is facing a rare bipartisan backlash after a group of federal agents shot and killed protester Alex Pretti in Minneapolis on Saturday, but tech industry leaders – once some of Trump’s fiercest critics – are sitting this one out....

item.title: Jennifer Garner’s Once Upon a Farm resumes IPO plans
item.description: The organic kids' snack food company may debut as soon as next week. It has issued a price range for shares, an SEC filing shows.

item.title: Still using WinRAR? You should probably look out for these potentially dangerous security flaws
item.description: A high severity flaw in WinRAR allows crooks to execute malware remotely.

item.title: The Surface Laptop Is $400 Off
item.description: Take home a sweet discount on Microsoft's first-party laptop.

item.title: Moltbot Is Taking Over Silicon Valley
item.description: People are letting the viral AI assistant formerly known as Clawdbot run their lives, regardless of the privacy concerns.

item.title: AI data labeler Handshake buys Cleanlab, an acquisition target of multiple others
item.description: The deal’s purpose is primarily to acquire talent, aka an acqui-hire, adding nine key Cleanlab employees to Handshake’s research organization.

item.title: Looking for a Nespresso machine? I'm a qualified barista and these are the 3 I recommend for authentic-tasting espresso
item.description: Want the convenience of instant coffee with the rich flavor of fresh beans? You need a Nespresso machine, and these are the best ones around.

item.title: The CEO of the ADL Said Elon Musk Is the ‘Henry Ford of Our Time.’ Unfortunately, He Was Right.
item.description: Grok, which once dubbed itself Mecha Hitler, is crowned the most anti-Semitic chatbot.

item.title: Another apparel brand is closing all retail stores. It was once a tech bro favorite
item.description: A growing number of retailers are reducing their physical footprint in favor of e-commerce, and the latest was once a Silicon Valley staple. Allbirds shoe brand announced on Wednesday that it will close all of its U.S. stores by the end of February (with the exception of two outlets) and go online, turning to e-commerce instead. It will, however, continue to operate two London-based brick-and-mortar locations....

item.title: Taxpayers may face issues this 2026 tax season after IRS layoffs and new laws, a watchdog warns
item.description: The IRS started 2025 with about 102,000 employees and finished with about 74,000. The national taxpayer advocate is cautioning that the 2026 tax filing season is likely to present challenges for taxpayers who encounter problems with filing their taxes given the exodus of IRS workers since the start of the Trump administration.
